categories.name: The Art of Sushi: Beyond the Roll

questions.clue: This type of sushi, often mistakenly called 'raw fish', actually refers to the vinegared rice used with various toppings.
In anime and manga, this sushi chef's knife, known for its precision, is often depicted to showcase a character's skill.
This type of sushi, which translates to 'inari', is named after a Shinto deity and is made with tofu skin.
A favorite in Japanese pop culture, this sushi topping is known as 'uni' and comes from a spiny sea creature.
In the manga 'Shota no Sushi', this cooking style is highlighted for its use of a blowtorch on top of sushi.

categories.name: Anime Worlds: From Studio Ghibli to Shonen Jump

questions.clue: This Studio Ghibli film features a young girl who works in a bathhouse in the spirit world.
In this anime, Ichigo Kurosaki becomes a Soul Reaper after meeting Rukia Kuchiki.
The Straw Hat Pirates sail the Grand Line in search of this legendary treasure.
This 2006 anime film by Studio Ghibli depicts the struggle of a Japanese family during WWII.
This dark fantasy anime follows Guts, a lone mercenary, in a world inspired by medieval Europe.
This long-running manga series by Eiichiro Oda features the adventures of Monkey D. Luffy and his crew searching for the ultimate treasure, the One Piece.
This manga, created by Masashi Kishimoto, follows a young ninja whose dream is to become the leader of his village, known as the Hokage.
This manga series by Tsugumi Ohba and Takeshi Obata features a high school student who gains a notebook that allows him to kill anyone by writing their name in it.
In this manga by Koyoharu Gotouge, a young boy named Tanjiro Kamado becomes a demon slayer after his family is slaughtered, and his sister is turned into a demon.
This manga by Naoko Takeuchi follows a teenage girl who transforms into the titular heroine, known for fighting evil by moonlight and winning love by daylight.
In 1941, she became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean, a feat celebrated by many, including fans of adventurous anime heroines.
This pioneering British scientist, who discovered the structure of DNA, has inspired many manga characters for her groundbreaking work in genetics.
A famous mathematician from the 19th century, she was a visionary who foresaw the potential of computers long before they existed, much like a sci-fi anime protagonist.
Known as the 'Mother of Modern Physics,' this Nobel laureate's pioneering research on radioactivity seems straight out of a science-heavy manga plot.
A Japanese feminist and writer, she defied traditional gender roles and was a key figure in the Taisho era, embodying the spirit of many strong-willed anime characters.
This popular Japanese dish often consists of vinegared rice, raw fish, and vegetables.
This Japanese style of animated film and television show is known for its colorful artwork and fantastical themes.
In Japanese culture, this term refers to a genre of graphic novels and comics, some of which are adapted into anime.
This Japanese word describes a genre of adult-oriented anime and manga, which is often controversial.
In Japan, this traditional performance art combines singing, acting, and dancing, characterized by elaborate costumes and makeup.

final.clue: This culinary art form, often associated with Japan, shares its name with a popular manga and anime character known for her love of food and culinary adventures.
